alert.note: Alert for Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 1:23AM PST until December 23 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...AREAS OF FREEZING RAIN AND WINTRY MIX POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Wintry mix and periods of freezing rain expected, which could result a thin layer of ice. * WHERE...Portions of the Klamath Basin as well as portions of Lake County below 5000 feet. This includes Highways 97, 395, 31, 140, 62, 66 and 139. This does include the communities of Klamath Falls, Chiloquin, Chemult, Bly, Lakeview, Dorris, Macdoel, and Paisley. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Ice will create slippery and hazardous road conditions, which may impact the morning commute. This could also create a slip hazard on walkways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Confidence in the potential for freezing rain is highest from Chemult northward, but isolated areas of wintry mix and freezing rain are possible elsewhere in the advisory area. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for wintry mix means that periods of slippery conditions will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties
